results.title: Exercise Musk-ox
results.creator_credit: Douglas Wilkinson, E Scythes, Robert Anderson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A journey of scientific exploration through Canada’s north. Members of the Canadian Army, with snowmobiles and amphibious weasel, made a great winter trek over country never before travelled by motor vehicle. The expedition took detailed weather observations, corrected maps, studied the mobility of snow vehicles, and coped with the weather. Through human skill and endurance the frontier of the north was pushed back, showing its rich promise for the future.

results.title: Exchange place
results.creator_credit: Gary Gasgarth, Marc De Rossi and Texture Films
results.brief_description: A story told in mime. Rich man, beggar, thief, shoeshine boy and waiter are linked in this original and ironic tale. All parts are played by the mime, Don Jordan and using masks and body movement, he projects each character not only as a distinct personality, but also as an unforgettable social type.

results.title: The Exceptional child
results.brief_description: A report on studies of children of unusual natural abilities or rate of development made in Great Britain, the United States and South Africa. Covers very rapid mental development, reading difficulties, stammering, accident proneness and delinquency, and evidence for pre-natal influence on these.

results.title: The Evolution of vascular plants: the ferns
results.brief_description: Describes the evolution of vascular systems in land plants. The highly specialised structures that occur in vascular plants are shown through investigation of the fern. The film explains the adaptive advantages of vascular systems in land plants, and shows how biologists reconstruct the story of the plant evolution by studying fossils and living plants.

results.title: Evolution of Man
results.brief_description: The story of human ancestry is a theoretical one because the fossil record is so incomplete. Traces Darwin’s theory of evolution and the discovery and reconstruction of pre-human fossils, including those at Olduvai Gorge in East Africa.

results.title: Evolution and the origin of life
results.brief_description: Uses cinemicroscopy, time-lapse photography, special effects, animation, macro-photography, and documentary and nature footage to survey the history of the earth from its beginning. Topics represented include DNA, bacteria photosynthesis, flagellates, sexual reproduction, multicellular colonies, the Miller-Urey ‘hot soup’ experiment, and Darwin’s theories.

results.title: Evidence for the Ice Age
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains how anomalous geological formations such as moraines and erratics, polished and straited rocks, resulting from glacial action, show that much of the temperate area has been under ice sheets. For schools.

results.title: Evictions
results.creator_credit: Richard Lowenstein and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Documentary/drama on police-enforced evictions in Melbourne during the 1930’s depression and the tactics the organised unemployed used at the time to combat the situation. Based on the memories of Noel Counihan and Tom Hills and adapted from the book ‘Weevils in the flour’ by Wendy Lowenstein, the film combines interviews with period reconstruction. Erwin Rado Award for Best Australian Short Fiction, Melbourne Film Festival, 1980.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Lowenstein and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: Everything under the sun [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Who are the Australians? The film shows them at work, at home and at play. It depicts the sophistication of the cities and the sparseness of the outback. It reveals that already there are traditions and national pride. A study of Australia and Australians with all the variety and colour of the modern Australian scene. Note: A short version, intended mainly for overseas viewers, of “After Cook”. In English and Italian.
